title: How to build Nasus now?
body:
So I've been going through my champion item builds after the recent patches, trying to rework them to fit with the new season. I thought I'd check in on a couple, the first being Nasus.

Before him build was perfect. I'd go {{item:3025}} > {{item:3110}} > {{item:3065}} for 40% CDR and decent stats, then into whatever else was needed, like {{item:3026}} or {{item:3083}}.

Now, with gauntlet giving 20% CDR, I'm not too sure if I keep building it that way (I just love SV and FH on Nasus, so getting rid of them is not an option) or exchange gauntlet for something else? I've been toying with the idea of {{item:3812}}. Lifesteal, 10% CDR to bring total back up to 40%, and damage taken is slowly bled, allowing you to engage in prolonged fights with your Q.

But then I'd miss out on the awesome Spellblade ability of {{item:3025}}. I mean, the slow can easily be replaced by {{item:3022}}, but not the Spellblade. I don't really want to go {{item:3078}} as it leaves Nasus too little defence, and costs too much.

So basically, how do you build Nasus? Just a balanced build. Full tank I go {{item:3110}} {{item:3065}} {{item:3742}} {{item:3083}} and {{item:3102}} or {{item:3026}}. Full damage/lifesteal fun, I go {{item:3065}} {{item:3110}} then as much life steal I can get like {{item:3153}} {{item:3072}} etc.

I've been cleaning up either way. Pretty much once I get 200 stacks and my SV and FH, I'm good to snowball. But for argument's sake, I'd like to know for a run of the mill, balanced build, what would you suggest? Bite the bullet and let there be some unused CDR? Or something else?

Regards!

P.S. A question I've always wanted to know… do enemies killed by Frozen Gauntlet's spell blade passive (AoE damage) add to Nasus' stacks?
